required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intra-arterial Recombinant Human TNK Tissue-type Plasminogen Activator (rhTNK-tPA) Thrombolysis for Acute Large Vascular Occlusion After Successful Mechanical Thrombectomy Recanalization
clinical_study.official_title: Intra-arterial Recombinant Human Tenecteplase Tissue-type Plasminogen Activator rhTNK-tPA) Thrombolysis for Acute Large Vessel Occlusion After Successful Mechanical Thrombectomy Recanalization -- A Multicenter, Prospective, Randomized, Open-label, Blinded End-point Trial (ANGEL-TNK)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this clinical trial is to evaluate whether intra-arterial (IA) rhTNK-tPA thrombolysis can improve neurological outcomes in acute large vessel occlusion patients after successful mechanical thrombectomy (MT) recanalization between 4.5- 24 hours from symptom onset. Participants enrolled will be randomly assigned to study or control arm with a 1:1ratio. Study group will receive IA rhTNK-tPA thrombolysis (0.125 mg/kg, Max 12.5mg) plus best medical management, and control receive best medical management alone.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of 90 (±7) day modified Rankin scale (mRS) 0-1

secondary_outcome.measure: Infarct core volume change from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days (±1 day) after randomization/at discharge or at 36 hours (±12 hours) after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Infarct core volume change from baseline, assessed with NCCT at 7 days (±1 day) after randomization/at discharge or with MRI at 36 hours (±12 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: NIHSS 0-1 or decrease ≥10 from baseline NIHSS
secondary_outcome.description: NIHSS 0-1 or decrease ≥10 from baseline NIHSS

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of any intracranial hemorrhage (Heidelberg Bleeding Classification)
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of any intracranial hemorrhage (Heidelberg Bleeding Classification)

arm_group.description: Patients of this group will receive IA rhTNK-tPA plus Best Medical Management (BMM) after successful mechanical thrombectomy (MT) recanalization
Patients of this group will receive Best Medical Management (BMM) alone after successful mechanical thrombectomy (MT) recanalization

intervention.intervention_name: Recombinant Human tenecteplase Tissue-type Plasminogen Activator (rhTNK-tPA)
intervention.description: The administration of rhTNK-tPA will be infused constant and slowly over 15min (0.125 mg/kg, Max 12.5mg) through a microcatheter.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Department of interventional neurology
